abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority Board votes to raise base fare on subway and bus rides by a quarter, to $2.75, and cost of 30-day MetroCard by $4.50, to $116.50; increases are set to take effect March 22, 2015, and are part of authority's long-term revenue strategy.
lead_paragraph: Fare increases, the latest of which will take effect on March 22, are scheduled to occur every two years as part of the authority’s long-term revenue plans.
snippet: Fare increases, the latest of which will take effect on March 22, are scheduled to occur every two years as part of the authority’s long-term revenue plans.

headline.main: M.T.A. Is Raising Fares and Tolls; One Subway or Bus Ride Will Cost $2.75
headline.print_headline: Transit Agency Is Raising Fares and Tolls; One Subway or Bus Ride Will Cost $2.75
